quote: This was the most fun I've had racing my bike inâ€¦I think maybe ever.
This is a Top 5 all time favorite race!
It felt like I paid to be smashed with a hammer while breathing through a straw for 14 hours. When can I sign up again!
So sore, so tired, absolutely stoked!
Like a rave but for adult bike riders.
We get to choose the challenges we take on the bike. It's the real-life ones we don't get to pick.
My broken, sore body is going to take a while to forget what I did to it, but I'll never forget what I saw and experienced out there. This one is special.
The two lights seen are headlamps ahead of me

I was just barely surviving but the laughter and smiles there gave me some life. Or maybe it was the delicious turkey sandwich and garlic butter new potatoes?... I was treated like a king by the volunteers.
50+ volunteers out there split between the 5 aid stations. They truly made a racer feel as if we were the only one on course. They did anything and everything for you.

The first time I heard of the Vapor Trail 125 was about ten years ago when I first moved to Salida, CO... Year after year, I would watch as the whole town came out to cheer on people who came from all over the country as they set off on what seemed to be a death march.
